    • Method Detail

      • getNULL_SAFE_CURRENCY_THEN_AMOUNT_COMPARATOR

        public static java.util.Comparator getNULL_SAFE_CURRENCY_THEN_AMOUNT_COMPARATOR()
        A CurrencyAmount comparator based on the following rules: - Nulls are treated as less than all other values. - If two CurrencyAmounts have different Currencies, then uses their Currency priority values for comparison. Otherwise, uses their amount values (BigDecimals) for comparison.

      • compare

        public static int compare(CurrencyAmount amount1,
          CurrencyAmount amount2)
        Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

        Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to CurrencyAmount.compareTo(CurrencyAmount) .

        Parameters:
        amount1 -
        amount2 -

      • compareMultiCurrency

        public static int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount amount1,
                       CurrencyAmount amount2)
        Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

        Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to CurrencyAmount.compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount) .

        Parameters:
        amount1 -
        amount2 -

      • getStrict

        public static CurrencyAmount getStrict(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                       Currency currency)
        Constructs a CurrencyAmount from a BigDecimal amount and currency. The currency parameter cannot be null. The amount will be scaled as appropriate for the given currency, and the amount must not have more decimal digits than that scale allows. Use CurrencyUtil#roundToCurrencyScale in preference to this method if rounding is required when scaling the BigDecimal. For example, if it is the result of a divide or multiply operation.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        currency -

      • valueOf

        public static CurrencyAmount valueOf(IMoney money)
        Returns a CurrencyAmount whose amount and currency are equivalent to the given money. Returns null if either money or money.getAmount() is null.
        Parameters:
        money -
